Docs.summary: This is a primary interface in a COM coclass that is required by managed code for interoperability with the corresponding COM object. Use this primary interface only when the method you want to use shares the same name as an event of the COM object; in this case, cast to this interface to call the method, and cast to the latest events interface to connect to the event. Otherwise, use the .NET interface that is derived from the COM coclass to access methods, properties, and events of the COM object. For information about the COM object, see .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Activate() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Activates an inspector window by bringing it to the foreground and setting keyboard focus.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the parent Outlook application for the object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AttachmentSelection As AttachmentSelection

Docs.summary: Obtains an object consisting of one or more attachments that are selected in the inspector. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Caption As String
public: property System::String ^ Caption { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a String (string in C#) representing the title. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Class As OlObjectClass

Docs.summary: Returns an constant indicating the object's class. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close([in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Outlook.OlInspectorClose SaveMode) runtime managed

Docs.param: The close behavior. If the item displayed within the inspector has not been changed, this argument has no effect.
Docs.summary: Closes the and optionally saves changes to the displayed Outlook item.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CommandBars As CommandBars
public: property Microsoft::Office::Core::CommandBars ^ CommandBars { Microsoft::Office::Core::CommandBars ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: This object, member, or enumeration is deprecated and is not intended to be used in your code.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CurrentItem As Object
public: property System::Object ^ CurrentItem { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an Object representing the current item being displayed in the inspector. Read-only.

remarks.para: If no item is currently open, an error message will be returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Display([in]object Modal) runtime managed
Public Sub Display (Optional Modal As Object)

Docs.param: True to make the window modal. The default value is False.
Docs.summary: Displays a new object for the item.

remarks.para: The Display method is supported for explorer and inspector windows for the sake of backward compatibility. To activate an explorer or inspector window, use the method.

If you attempt to open an "unsafe" file system object (or "freedoc" file) by using the Microsoft Outlook object model, you receive the E_FAIL return code in the C or C++ programming languages. In Outlook 2000 and earlier, you could open an "unsafe" file system object by using the Display method.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property EditorType As OlEditorType

Docs.summary: Returns an constant indicating the type of editor. Read-only.

remarks.para: Since Microsoft Office Outlook 2007, the EditorType property always returns olEditorWord.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Height { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer (int in C#) value specifying the height (in pixels) of the inspector window. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void HideFormPage([in]string PageName) runtime managed

Docs.param: The display name of the form page, or the internal name of a form region to be hidden.
Docs.summary: Hides a form page or form region in the inspector.

remarks.para: You can use HideFormRegion to hide a form region by specifying the property of the form region, if the form region is an adjoining or separate form region. Only the add-in that implements the form region can hide the form region.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property HTMLEditor As Object
public: property System::Object ^ HTMLEditor { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: This object, member, or enumeration is deprecated and is not intended to be used in your code.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsWordMail() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Determines whether the mail message associated with an inspector is displayed in an Outlook or in Microsoft Word.
Docs.returns: True if the mail message is displayed in Microsoft Word (that is, if Word Mail is in use); otherwise, False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Left { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer (int in C#) value specifying the position (in pixels) of the left vertical edge of an inspector window from the edge of the screen. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ModifiedFormPages As Object
public: property System::Object ^ ModifiedFormPages { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the collection that represents all the pages for the item in the inspector. Read-only.

remarks.para: The main page and up to five customizable pages can be obtained using the method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object NewFormRegion() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Opens a new page in design mode in the inspector for a new form region.
Docs.returns: An Object that represents the page displaying the form region in the inspector.

remarks.para: If the inspector is not already in design mode, NewFormRegion will put it in design mode.
This method only opens a page for a new form region in design mode. This method is not intended for creating a form region at runtime.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object OpenFormRegion([in]string Path) runtime managed
Public Function OpenFormRegion (Path As String) As Object

Docs.param: A full local file path to the Outlook Form Storage (.OFS) file for the form region that is to be opened in the inspector.
Docs.summary: Opens a page in design mode in the inspector for the specified form region.
Docs.returns: An Object that represents the page displaying the form region in the inspector.

remarks.para: If the inspector is not already in design mode, OpenFormRegion will put it in design mode.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the parent Object of the specified object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SaveFormRegion (object Page, string FileName);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SaveFormRegion([in]object Page, [in]string FileName) runtime managed
Public Sub SaveFormRegion (Page As Object, FileName As String)
public: void SaveFormRegion(System::Object ^ Page, System::String ^ FileName);

Docs.param: The page displaying the form region in the inspector.
The full local file path to an Outlook Form Storage (.OFS) file that the form region is being saved to.
Docs.summary: Saves the specified page in design mode in the inspector to the specified file.

remarks.para: In order for SaveFormRegion to save the form region, the form region must have been loaded in design mode in the inspector.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Session As NameSpace

Docs.summary: Returns the object for the current session. Read-only.

remarks.para: The Session property and the method can be used interchangeably to obtain the NameSpace object for the current session. Both members serve the same purpose. For example, the following pairs of statements perform the same function:

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetControlItemProperty (object Control, string PropertyName);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetControlItemProperty([in]object Control, [in]string PropertyName) runtime managed
Public Sub SetControlItemProperty (Control As Object, PropertyName As String)
public: void SetControlItemProperty(System::Object ^ Control, System::String ^ PropertyName);

Docs.param: The control that will be bound to a property.
The name of the property that will be bound to the control.
Docs.summary: Binds a built-in property or custom property to a control in an inspector.

remarks.para: You can use this method to bind an explicit built-in property or a custom property to a control. You must reference the property by its string name, for example, Subject, and not by namespace, for example, http://schemas.microsoft.com/mapi/proptag/0x0037001E.
The parameter is not case-sensitive. For example, SetControlItemProperty interprets an argument, CustomerId, to be the same as CustomerID and binds the specified control to the built-in property.

You can also use the following line of code myPage.Controls("bar").ItemProperty = "subject" to bind the subject property to a control. However, note that untrusted code using this will trigger a security warning if the property is protected by the object model security guard such as To, and the client computer is running Microsoft Office Outlook 2007 or later but does not have an appropriately set up antivirus software. You can use the SetControlItemProperty method to avoid security warnings with trusted applications. For more information, see Security Behavior of the Outlook Object Model

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetCurrentFormPage([in]string PageName) runtime managed

Docs.param: The display name of the form page, or the internal name of the form region.
Docs.summary: Displays the specified form page or form region in the inspector.

remarks.para: You can use SetCurrentFormPage to display a form region by specifying the property of the form region, if the form region is an a separate, replace, or replace-all form region.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetSchedulingStartTime([in]valuetype System.DateTime Start) runtime managed

Docs.param: The beginning of the time range that the Scheduling Assistant tab of the inspector displays free/busy times for meeting attendees.
Docs.summary: Sets the start time for a meeting item in the free/busy grid on the Scheduling Assistant tab of the inspector.

remarks.para: The object specified by the property of the parent object must be an or . The Scheduling Assistant tab must be displayed in the inspector, otherwise Microsoft Outlook raises an error. If Outlook cannot display the Scheduling Assistant tab for that item type, Outlook displays the following error: The scheduling start time can only be set when the Scheduling Assistant is displayed on a meeting item.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ShowFormPage([in]string PageName) runtime managed

Docs.param: The display name of the form page, or the internal name of a form region to be shown.
Docs.summary: Displays a button in the Show group of the Microsoft Office Fluent ribbon for the inspector, clicking which will show the page or form region specified by .

remarks.para: For form regions, you can use ShowFormPage to display the button by specifying the property of the form region, if the form region is an adjoining or separate form region. Only the add-in that implements the form region can use ShowFormRegion to display the button.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Top { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer (int in C#) value indicating the position (in pixels) of the top horizontal edge of an inspector window from the edge of the screen. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Width { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer (int in C#) value indicating the width (in pixels) of the specified object. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlWindowState WindowState { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlWindowState get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlWindowState value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the property with a constant in the enumeration specifying the window state of an explorer or inspector window. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property WordEditor As Object
public: property System::Object ^ WordEditor { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the Microsoft Word Document Object Model of the message being displayed. Read-only.

remarks.para: The WordEditor property is only valid if returns True and the is olEditorWord. The returned WordDocument object provides access to most of the Word object model except for the following members:
